snippet: Many insurers say they are asking for higher premiums because they remain unsure about the future and what their medical costs will be.
abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services data shows for the 37 states using HealthCare.gov as their exchange, insurance companies are seeking very different rate increases, some as high as 85 percent, for premiums in 2016; officials caution final rates still have yet to be set and experts warn that data is not sure predictor of prices; proposed rate increases are due to insurers uncertainty.
lead_paragraph: Many insurers say they are asking for higher premiums because they remain unsure about the future and what their medical costs will be.

headline.main: Seeking Rate Increases, Insurers Use Guesswork

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
